body_html:
The issue seems to reappear with pytorch v0.3.0.post4.
I'm using Anaconda, with python version 3.6.3. The "free() invalid pointer" error pops up when attempting to train my network on the GPU.

*** Error in `python': free(): invalid pointer: 0x00007f58f8940e80 ***
======= Backtrace: =========
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x777e5)[0x7f59004857e5]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x8037a)[0x7f590048e37a]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(cfree+0x4c)[0x7f590049253c]
/home/abbhinav/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_thnn/_THCUNN.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so(+0x2b582)[0x7f5554be7582]
python(_PyCFunction_FastCallDict+0x91)[0x55cc3a3c22a1]
python(+0x19eebc)[0x55cc3a454ebc]
python(_PyEval_EvalFrameDefault+0x30a)[0x55cc3a47662a]
python(PyEval_EvalCodeEx+0x329)[0x55cc3a44f8d9]
python(+0x19a6f4)[0x55cc3a4506f4]
python(PyObject_Call+0x3e)[0x55cc3a3c216e]
/home/abbhinav/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so(_Z17THPFunction_applyP7_objectS0_+0x271)[0x7f58f7448fe1] ....

body:
The issue seems to reappear with pytorch v0.3.0.post4. 
I'm using Anaconda, with python version 3.6.3. The "free() invalid pointer" error pops up when attempting to train my network on the GPU. 
```
*** Error in `python': free(): invalid pointer: 0x00007f58f8940e80 ***
======= Backtrace: =========
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x777e5)[0x7f59004857e5]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(+0x8037a)[0x7f590048e37a]
/lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6(cfree+0x4c)[0x7f590049253c]
/home/abbhinav/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_thnn/_THCUNN.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so(+0x2b582)[0x7f5554be7582]
python(_PyCFunction_FastCallDict+0x91)[0x55cc3a3c22a1]
python(+0x19eebc)[0x55cc3a454ebc]
python(_PyEval_EvalFrameDefault+0x30a)[0x55cc3a47662a]
python(PyEval_EvalCodeEx+0x329)[0x55cc3a44f8d9]
python(+0x19a6f4)[0x55cc3a4506f4]
python(PyObject_Call+0x3e)[0x55cc3a3c216e]
/home/abbhinav/anaconda3/lib/python3.6/site-packages/torch/_C.cpython-36m-x86_64-linux-gnu.so(_Z17THPFunction_applyP7_objectS0_+0x271)[0x7f58f7448fe1] ....
```
